conclusion: Analyze the situation using conservation of momentum, conservation of energy, and effect of magnetic field on charged ball Q.
Ball P has mass M = 4m, no charge, initial velocity v0 = mg/qB.
Ball Q has mass m, charge -q, initial velocity 0.
Magnetic field B is directed outward from the plane of the paper, affecting only ball Q.
Collision is elastic, conserving momentum and kinetic energy.
Determine velocity of Q after collision; it will move into magnetic field B causing circular motion.
Apply conservation of momentum: Mv0 = Mv1 + mv2, leading to equation 4mg/qB = 4v1 + v2.
Apply conservation of kinetic energy: 1/2 Mv0^2 = 1/2 Mv1^2 + 1/2 mv2^2, leading to equation 4m^2g^2/q^2B^2 = 4v1^2 + v2^2.
